Award.AwardTitle: Participant Support for the Workshop on Differential Geometry
Award.AbstractNarration:
This award supports participation by mathematicians from the United States in the Sixth Workshop on Differential Geometry, which is being held near Cordoba, Argentina, August 1-5, 2016. The workshop brings together experts from around the world to present recent advances in differential geometry and to facilitate further progress on major open problems. A series of minicourses will expose participants to a broad spectrum of subdisciplines. The majority of the researchers who will receive travel support through the award will be graduate students, recent doctoral degree recipients, and members of groups underrepresented in mathematics. The minicourses and research lectures, as well as the opportunity to interact with participants from around the world, will help to broaden and deepen the research trajectories of junior participants. The workshop is the sixth in a series of workshops on differential geometry held in the environs of Cordoba, Argentina. These workshops have facilitated very fruitful and mutually beneficial collaborations between Argentine and U.S. researchers.

The workshop will focus on applications of Lie transformation groups to several central areas of differential geometry, including geometric flows and solitons, holonomy and its applications, special geometric structures, and dynamics on Riemannian manifolds. The workshop will foster the cross-fertilization of ideas across these areas as well as facilitate new collaborations to advance research in each of the individual areas. Minicourses will address Kahler geometry, Yamabe invariants, calibrations and minimal volume submanifolds, Ricci solitons, spectral geometry, and dynamical aspects of geodesics. Further information can be found at the workshop web site: www.famaf.unc.edu.ar/egeo2016

POR.DRECONTENT:
This award supported travel for seventeen mathematicians from the United States to participate in the 6th Workshop on Differential Geometry, which was held in Argentina, August 1–5, 2016.  

The workshop brought together experts from around the world to address recent advances in differential geometry with the underlying theme of Lie group actions. The workshop also exposed participants, especially the junior participants, to a broad spectrum of subdisciplines through six short courses on topics including Kaehler geometry, Yamabe invariants, calibrations and minimal volume submanifolds, Ricci solitons, spectral geometry, and dynamical aspects of geodesics.  The workshop helped to foster the cross-fertilization of ideas across these areas as well as facilitate new collaborations to advance research in each of the individual areas.

The majority of the researchers who received travel support to attend the workshop were graduate students and recent Ph.D.’s.  Among the senior participants supported, the majority were members of underrepresented groups in mathematics.  The mini-courses and research lectures, as well as the opportunity to interact with participants from around the world, have helped to broaden and deepen the research trajectories of these participants.

The location of the workshop in Argentina provided a special opportunity to interact with the very strong and diverse community of Argentine researchers in differential geometry, most of whom are able to travel only rarely outside of Argentina due to the prohibitive cost.  The workshop was the sixth in a series of workshops on differential geometry held in the environs of Cordoba, Argentina, and facilitated very fruitful and mutually beneficial collaborations between Argentine and U.S. researchers.
